bug.author: cancan101
bug.summary: Reload Button in Tensorboard 1.1rc1 Resets Chart Scales
bug.description:
In tensorboard 1.1rc1, hitting the "reload button", <denchmark-link:https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/51059/24721828/7f66e63a-1a0f-11e7-9942-15d4609e0e46.png></denchmark-link> , causes the scaling on the charts to reset. That was not the case in 1.0.1. For example if I zoom in here: <denchmark-link:https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/51059/24721857/9772cd7a-1a0f-11e7-8e4a-3f6535df7edb.png></denchmark-link>
to: <denchmark-link:https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/51059/24721867/9cedb1a2-1a0f-11e7-9a0d-24d57648d242.png></denchmark-link>
this zoom is lost.

comments.comment: The same scale reset happens when checking and unchecking runs.
Any chance this will fixed before final 1.1 release?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/dandelionmane>@dandelionmane</denchmark-link> It looks like TF 1.1 is shipping. Did this get fixed?
This appears to still happen in TF 1.1.
Any update on this? This isn't a performance bug â€“ it's a usability issue.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/dandelionmane>@dandelionmane</denchmark-link> any chance this is fixed in 1.2.0?
This is still happening in 1.2.0-rc0. Is this changed behavior intentional?

Looks like Chi migrated this to our new repository at <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorboard/issues/36>tensorflow/tensorboard#36</denchmark-link> , so I'm closing it. Please feel free to continue discussion there.
